contextId.information: This refers to people who are still living and people who have died. AT: "the people who are alive and the people who are dead" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
This refers to sick people. AT: "sick people" or "those who were sick" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
You can state this nominal adjective as an adjective. AT: "weak persons" or "those who are weak" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
